newsitem.title: UK: UK announces aid rate for oilseed producers.
newsitem.headline: UK announces aid rate for oilseed producers.

text.p: The area aid paid to farmers in England for the 1996 oilseeds crop will be 448.15 stg per hectare, the UK ministry of agriculture fisheries and food (MAFF) said.
It incorporates a reduction of five per cent due to high oilseed prices in the 1996/97 marketing year, MAFF said on Friday.
This rate applies to oilseeds grown under the European Union's arable area payments system.

Payments are increased if observed prices are lower than a projected reference price and reduced if they are higher, subject to an eight per cent franchise. The price observed for 1996/97 was 13 per cent above the reference level, which, when the franchise is taken away gives the five per cent reduction.
